title: Venezuela’s Opposition Vote Count Extends Into Second Day
description: The vote count for Venezuela’s opposition primary extended into a second day, muddling what had seemed like a straightforward victory for María Corina Machado as organizers faced technical difficulties and the ruling party made allegations of fraud.

title: China’s Wang to Visit Washington This Week Amid Middle East Tensions
description: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi will visit Washington this week for high-level meetings, according to senior Biden administration officials, as the US and China continue a series of diplomatic engagements intended to manage tensions even as a new war in the Middle East shows the limits of potential cooperation.

title: US-China Tensions Are Top Geopolitical Risk, BlackRock Says
description: The “strategic competition” between the US and China remains the top geopolitical risk facing markets worldwide, according to BlackRock Inc., which described the recent thaw in the relations of the world’s two biggest economies as “fragile.”

title: US Vows to Hold Iran Responsible for Attacks on Troops in Mideast
description: The US ramped up its rhetoric toward Iran, saying it would hold Tehran accountable for drone and rocket attacks on US troops by its proxies in the Middle East, even as Washington tries to avert a wider regional war.

title: What Is Jihad and What Does Hamas Say About It?
description: What is “jihad”? The debate over the meaning of the word was reignited after the Palestinian group Hamas provoked a new war by massacring 1,400 people in Israel. The group, which is designated by the US and Europe as a terrorist organization, uses the word to describe its violent campaign to destroy Israel. But Hamas differs in significant ways from the most notorious jihadi groups of the past two decades, al-Qaeda and Islamic State.

title: Why Bond Yields Are Sending a Warning Signal to Washington
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economics enterprise reporter Rich Miller assesses the impact of higher bond yields. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Hamas Frees Two Elderly Women in Latest Gaza Hostage Release
description: Hamas militants freed two more hostages, both elderly women, from the Gaza Strip on Monday, signaling that efforts focused on winning the freedom of the more than 200 people seized in the deadly Oct. 7 raid into Israel may be bearing fruit.

title: Bob Menendez Pleads Not Guilty in Egyptian Foreign Agent Case
description: US Senator Bob Menendez pleaded not guilty to a new federal charge that he conspired with his wife and a businessman to act as an agent of Egypt while he was chairman of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee.

title: Venezuela Set to Restart Hydro Supply Deal in Northern Brazil
description: Venezuela agreed to resume sending hydroelectric power to the Manaus region of Brazil, a move that strengthens energy ties between President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s government and Nicolas Maduro’s socialist regime.

title: Harvard Criticized by Klarman, Romney Over Campus Antisemitism
description: Five Harvard Business School alumni including US Senator Mitt Romney and hedge fund manager Seth Klarman criticized Harvard University over its response to protests by pro-Palestinian demonstrators, saying the school ignored the safety of Jewish students.

title: Argentina's Election: Massa's Gradual Approach Versus Milei's Radical Plans
description: Top presidential candidates face off in November with completely opposite proposals to pull Latin America's second-largest economy from the brink of abyss.

title: Argentina’s Money Machine and Fear Were All It Took to Stop Milei’s Surge
description: Javier Milei truly believed he would celebrate turning 53 by winning Argentina’s presidency in the first round. The ballroom in a traditional yet démodé hotel in downtown Buenos Aires was thrumming to club beats and glowing in his signature campaign purple. Guests had been flown from around the world to toast the upset.

title: Massa-Milei Runoff in Argentina Is Investors’ Worst-Case Scenario for Bonds
description: Wall Street is bracing for more losses on Argentina’s sovereign bonds after Sunday’s presidential ballot sent the contest to a second round between Economy Minister Sergio Massa and libertarian outsider Javier Milei — the scenario that investors had feared most.

title: Biden Picks Elizabeth Warren’s Chief of Staff as Brainard’s New Deputy
description: President Joe Biden has selected Jon Donenberg, the chief of staff to Senator Elizabeth Warren, as the next deputy director of the National Economic Council, in the latest indication the White House plans to forcefully pursue progressive financial regulations.

title: Deadly Gaza Hospital Blast Came From Missile Launched Towards Israel, Says Sunak
description: The Government has judged that a deadly blast at a Gaza hospital last week was "likely caused by a missile, or part of one, that was launched from within Gaza towards Israel", Prime Minister Rishi Sunak told MPs.

title: Swiss Voters See Capping Health-Care Costs as Top Priority
description: Switzerland’s new parliament should make reining in health-care costs their top priority, a majority of voters said in a poll after Sunday’s election.

title: Here Are the Key Market Reactions to Argentina’s Election Surprise
description: Economy Minister Sergio Massa took 37% of the vote Sunday in Argentina’s presidential election, forcing a runoff against outsider libertarian Javier Milei, who had been the frontrunner. Here are the key takeaways:

title: Hostages and Hezbollah Force Israel to Rethink Gaza Ground War
description: More than two weeks since Israel declared war on Hamas and enlisted hundreds of thousands of troops in an unprecedented call-up, there are growing calls inside the country to rethink the scope of a ground invasion that had been expected any day.

title: Zimbabwe Seeks Compensation for Pensioners Whose Savings Were Wiped Out in 2009
description: Zimbabwe wants the retirement industry to help compensate pensioners who lost their savings 14 years ago following a bout of hyperinflation that led to the collapse of the local currency and its eventual scrapping in favor of the US dollar.

title: Turkey Sends Sweden NATO Membership Bill to Parliament
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan signed and sent a bill approving Sweden’s NATO membership to Turkey’s parliament for a vote, Erdogan’s office said.

title: Microsoft to Invest $3.2 Billion to Boost AI and Tech in Australia
description: Microsoft Corp. will invest A$5 billion ($3.2 billion) in Australia to expand its cloud computing and AI infrastructure over the next two years, in what the US company described as its largest investment in the country in four decades.

title: Hostage Diplomacy May Alter Israel's Gaza Invasion Plans
description: Israel’s support for diplomatic efforts to get Hamas to release hostages — quickly and in large numbers — may delay and possibly restrain its planned ground war in Gaza, according to people familiar with the negotiations.

title: Can the UK's AI Summit Make it a Tech Leader?
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Tinubu Pledges to Ease Forex Liquidity Crunch: Nigeria Summit
description: Nigerian President Bola Tinubu said the liquidity squeeze that has resulted in the naira weakening to record lows against the dollar will ease.

title: EU Leaders Plan to Support UN Call for Pause in Israel-Hamas War
description: European Union leaders are aiming to endorse a United Nations call for a “humanitarian pause” in the Israel-Hamas war to allow for the distribution of aid in Gaza.

title: Putin and Zelenskiy Face a Decisive Winter War
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: New German Far-Left Party Aims to Challenge Scholz’s Coalition
description: A German Left party politician who has criticized military support for Ukraine announced the creation of a breakaway group that is set to shake up opposition to Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s coalition government.

title: How Massa Halted Milei’s Momentum: Argentina Election Takeaways
description: Once again, Argentina proved that when it comes to politics, expect the unexpected. The government’s candidate, Sergio Massa, didn’t just come out top in Sunday’s election, he came close to winning the presidency outright.

title: Biden Administration Chooses 31 Tech Hubs to Spur Investment
description: The Biden administration has designated 31 regions across the country as technology hubs, a stamp of approval that’s meant to marshal private capital into core areas of federal investment.

title: Denmark’s Deputy Prime Minister Resigns After Party’s Support Slumps
description: Jakob Ellemann-Jensen, leader of Denmark’s Liberal Party and the deputy prime minister in the majority coalition government, is leaving politics after his backing suffered a sharp decline in opinion polls.

title: US, Allies Hold Talks On Concerns Israel-Hamas War Will Spread
description: US President Joe Biden and the leaders of France, Germany, the UK and Canada spoke on Sunday about strategies to prevent the Israel-Hamas war from spreading to the wider Middle East.

title: Ukraine Recap: EU Foreign Ministers Due to Reaffirm Kyiv Support
description: Foreign ministers of the European Union meeting in Luxembourg are expected to reaffirm support for Ukraine despite the Israel-Hamas conflict dominating the agenda, amid fears that it could spread.

title: Pakistan Court Indicts Imran Khan for Making Secret Cable Public
description: A Pakistani court framed charges against former Prime Minister Imran Khan for making public the contents of a diplomatic cable to allegedly show his ouster from power last year was part of a conspiracy led by the US and the South Asian country’s powerful military, local media reported.

title: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day
description: Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

title: Israel Latest: Hostage Talks Delay Invasion as Gaza Awaits Aid
description: Israel is holding off a ground invasion of Gaza as diplomatic efforts continue to secure the release of more hostages. Oil edged lower after two weeks of gains, while Israeli data is set to show the economic impact of Hamas’s attacks on the country.

title: Venezuela’s Machado Projected as Primary Winner in Early Count
description: Venezuela’s María Corina Machado is projected to have a commanding lead in an early count of Sunday’s primary in a demonstrative turnout by opposition voters, putting her in position to challenge President Nicolás Maduro in general elections next year.

title: UK Pushing Pensions Into Private Equity Draws Industry Backlash
description: UK Chancellor Jeremy Hunt is facing a pension industry backlash over plans to push more savings into risky unlisted assets like private equity and public building projects.

title: Latin American Leaders Agree to Boost Economy to Stop Migration
description: Mexican President Andres Manuel Lopez Obrador hosted officials from nine Latin American countries to discuss strategies to reduce the flow of migrants up north, an increasingly hot topic as both Mexico and the US hold presidential elections next year.

title: Venezuela Opposition Primary Results Delayed as Server Blocked
description: Venezuela’s opposition primary results will take longer than expected because a server was blocked during the tallying of votes, according to organizers.

title: War Leaves Saudi Prince’s Dream of a New Mideast in Tatters
description: The Future Investment Initiative starts in Riyadh on Oct. 24 — and the annual event risks being overshadowed by the Israel-Hamas war.

title: Argentina Markets Brace for Selloff After Massa Forces Runoff
description: Argentina investors again braced for a selloff after Economy Minister Sergio Massa did better than forecast in Sunday’s presidential vote, dashing hopes for an outright win by a more market-friendly candidate.

title: Philippines Says China Provocation at Sea Won’t Deter Operations
description: The Philippines has urged China to halt “provocative actions” in the South China Sea a day after Manila said two of its vessels collided with Chinese boats during a mission to deliver supplies to a military outpost.

title: Argentina Heads to Runoff as Massa Gained Edge Over Milei
description: Argentina’s election will be settled in a presidential runoff between Economy Minister Sergio Massa, who defied expectations to snatch the lead in Sunday’s election, and libertarian outsider Javier Milei. It’s a politically polarizing scenario that investors had feared the most.
